laboratory_examinations.findings: Mucosal hyperemia and friability observed. Multiple biopsy samples were histologically normal.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Second gastroscopic examination six weeks later again showed hyperemia but no focal lesions.

laboratory_examinations.findings: The stomach was grossly normal. Microscopic foci of intramucosal diffuse carcinoma identified in two adjacent blocks from the gastric cardia.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Seven years later, Subject IV-3 is free of disease, with repeated endoscopic examinations and biopsies of the esophagojejunostomy site revealing no cancer.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Microscopic examination revealed early diffuse gastric cancer characterized by infiltrates of signet-ring cells.
